intro: Lippia rondonensis, commonly known as Brazilian sage, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Lippia rondonensis is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
